Next to the slasher films of the 1970s and 80s, ones about the walking dead were probably the second most popular horror sub-genre in modern times. The greedy executives in Hollywood rapidly cobbled together movies based on the theme from the existing back-catalog of zombie gorefests and original screenplays designed to capitalize on the title alone, and before long there were a thousand new variations on the zombie movie playing in every bucket cinema you can imagine.

This awful effort just goes to show what happens when you not only use computers to generate the effects, but also let them devise the plot and write the script. And you will save the reputation of the robot apocalypse.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to the original Disney fairy tale, thanks to computer graphics. The biggest mistake to my point of view is a pretty cover of Interstellar. The new music does help to get a little mood but I enjoy the original with its found instruments.
